attributes.comment:
I am writing to express my concern over the proposed fee increases for forms I-
600/I-600A, N-565, N-600, and Biometric Services (fingerprint processing). This
increase seems exorbitant in light of past fee increases. These forms and
services affect people who are in the process or adopting children from other
countries.

I compared the processing time of the I-600A/I-600 (3.39 months) to a form that
has a similar processing time, the I-140 (3.31 months). Despite similar
processing times, the I-140 has a much higher work volume (140,158 for the I-140
vs. 29,500 for the I-600/I-600A). However, the I-140 has a current fee of $195
compared to the I-600/I-600A's current fee of $545. In 1998, the I-600/I-600A's
fees increased by about 150% while the I-140 did not have any significant
increase up until this time, where the proposed increased amount is $475.

Considering these figures, it seems unfair to again impose an increase of fees on
people who are already in a very costly process to adopt a child.

One way you could save money in the fingerprinting area is to change the process
so that adoptive parents do not have to repeatedly go in for fingerprinting each
time their fingerprints "expire". It seems you could save a lot of money by only
fingerprinting prospective adoptive parents one time, then simply running their
already completed prints through the system when the time period expires to
make sure they hadn't committed any crimes in the meantime.

Thank you for the opportunity to express my concerns.

Lisa Wieskamp
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Lisa Wieskamp
